Package org.transitime.avl

Goal for the AVL module software was to be able to easily handle many different types of feeds.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AvlClient
    Receives data from the AvlJmsClient and processes it.
    AvlJmsClient
    Reads AVL data from JMS topic and processes it.
    AvlModule
    Subclass of Module to be used when reading AVL data from a feed.
    BatchGtfsRealtimeModule
    For reading in a batch of GTFS-realtime data and processing it.
    BusTimeSiriAvlModule
    Reads AVL data from the NYC MTA BusTime Siri AVL feed and publishes it to appropriate JMS topic so that it can be read by AVL clients.
    GtfsRealtimeModule  
    NextBusAvlModule
    Reads AVL data from a NextBus AVL feed and publishes it to appropriate JMS topic so that it can be read by AVL clients.
    PlaybackModule
    For running the system in "playback mode" where AVL data is read from the database instead of from a realtime AVL feed.
    TimeoutHandler
    For handling when a vehicle doesn't report its position for too long.
    XmlPollingAvlModule
    Polls XML feed for AVL data.

Package org.transitime.avl Description

Goal for the AVL module software was to be able to easily handle many different types of feeds. This includes XML pull feeds where a thread pulls data from XML feed on regular interval, XML push feed where the client writes XML data to a website, and more. Also wanted test projects to easily be able to read from a feed. To satisfy these goals JMS is used for the feeds. This allows for multiple subscribers so can easily have test projects using the same AVL data. Also allows components of the feed to reside on different servers so can easily have a pull feed on the predictor machine or a push feed on a separate web server machine. An AVL feed inherits from the org.transitime.modules.Module class. This means it is very easy to start. Also means that the Module.getProjectId() method is used specify which database the data is to be written to and the name of the JMS topic for the feed. To startup a pull AVL feed (such as for the NextBus feed) one simply does Module.start("org.transitime.avl.NextBusAvlModule"); The module will automatically run the AVL feed in a separate thread. Module.projectId() will be used to determine the name of the db to use. The Module.projectId() in turn gets the projectId from CoreConfig.getProjectId(). The JMS topic name used for the AVL feed is the same of the projectId. The topic names are dynamically configured so that one doesn't need to update a configuration file when a new agency is dealt with.
